newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico Bondes rates falls slightly at auction.
newsitem.headline: Mexico Bondes rates falls slightly at auction.

text.p: The rate on Mexican government 364-day development bonds, or Bondes, fell 0.06 percentage point to 1.30 percent above the one-month Cetes rate in Tuesday's primary auction, dealers estimated.
The 364-day Bondes were assigned at 98.82200 pesos.
Demand for the Bondes was 2.795 billion pesos, compared with the 500 million offered by the Banco de Mexico.
The rate on the 728-day Bondes fell 0.09 percentage point to 1.34 percent above the 28-day Cetes rate.
The 728-day Bondes were assigned at 97.82000 pesos.
Demand for the 728-day Bondes was 4.59 billion pesos, compared with the 700 million offered by the Banco de Mexico.
